instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
No liquid damage green light turns orange
G3h 12.55v,
Pp5v and p3v3 all present down to s0.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0.070 not shorted to gnd

What makes <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Post voltages for pins 1, 5, 7 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>.
Not really needed, it could be removed.

"<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0.070 not shorted to gnd"
Diode mode, or voltage?
Too low value for diode mode.
You can remove <RESISTOR>R7963</RESISTOR>-9, one by one, until <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> comes high.
Do NOT remove <RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR>; be sure is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>
Pin1 0.746v
Pin2 0.706v
Pin3 0.777v

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0.70v, 0.430 diode mode red on ground

<RESISTOR>R7697</RESISTOR> good 10k

When removed <RESISTOR>R7968</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> goes 3.3v and boots

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you get 1.5V at L7770?
Change <CHIP>U7710</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: changed <CHIP>U7710</CHIP> pins of l7770 are now fluctating between 1-2.4v and machine tries to boot when in the 1.5v range then shutsoff when above 1.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
All the resistors for <CHIP>U7710</CHIP> circuit measure correct and changed all caps to be safe still same behavior
Changed <CHIP>U7710</CHIP> again to be sure still same behavior

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
2V no good, that was the reason to pull down <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Check <RESISTOR>R7780</RESISTOR>/81, look at the formula...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yeah what i dont understand is why its giving up to 2.4v,
all the resistors are good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Adjust one of these resistors to get the correct 1.5V output...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in S0 but no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Removed L6201 got steady 1.5v
<CAPACITOR>C6211</CAPACITOR> was causing the problems even though it was measuring and looked fine

All fixed thank you
